alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Eastern Orleans; Lower Jefferson; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Bernard, southwestern Orleans, northwestern Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 530 PM CDT... At 459 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arabi, or near Chalmette. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 to 45 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Marrero, Harvey, Avondale, Timberlane, Metairie, Belle Chasse, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Elmwood, Violet, Terrytown, Meraux, Bridge City, Arabi, Woodmere and Waggaman. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 229 and 247. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Plaquemines; Eastern Orleans; Lower Jefferson; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans
